headline.main: Study Reports Dyslexia Is Not Unalterable, as Experts Have Been Assuming

docs.lead_paragraph: A large study of Connecticut schoolchildren has found that dyslexia, a reading problem in children, is not an unalterable disability, as many psychologists, educators and parents had assumed. Instead, the study found, most of the children who were considered dyslexic in the first grade were no longer dyslexic a few years later.
